metadata.titel_preek: On Signal: Breaking the Vicious Cycles

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The community of faith must enact economic divestment (Jubilee) to break cycles of accumulation and restore neighborliness.

bringing things back to where they ought to be
Moses announced to Israel God’s will
At the center of biblical faith is a command from God
give back to the people the land
the poor have their debts canceled

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is primarily a socio-economic habit and a psychological 'mean thought' rather than an ontological power.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God's future kingdom coming to earth.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: God
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon suggests God's vision only becomes reality 'when there is enough human obedience,' making the primary program (human action) the condition for the secondary (divine victory).

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is heavily weighted toward obligation (Must). It assumes the hearer has the power (Pouvoir) if they can overcome their lack of will (Vouloir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Accumulation) to S1 (Jubilee) via the negation of S1 (Resistance).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in human obedience to the 'Signal' (Jesus).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 is seen as a social 'vicious cycle' but not as a state of spiritual death requiring a Savior.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While using biblical language, the 'engine' of the sermon is human performance. God is the Sender of the law, and Jesus is the Example/Signal, but the Hearer is the Subject who must execute the divestment to bring about the Kingdom.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: that vision of God will only become reality when there is enough human obedience.
You must give it back... you must give it back.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jesus is presented as the one who 'enacts' Jubilee, serving as a model for Trinity Church to do the same.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: A theocentric reading would focus on God as the one who cancels the debt of Sin/Death through Christ, which then frees the believer to share resources.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Burden of responsibility; potential for pride if successful or guilt if failing.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Synergism where human action is the primary catalyst for eschatological fulfillment.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is logically coherent as a call to social action, but theologically incoherent regarding the relationship between grace and works.
spanning_punten: The quote 'I would rather have my debts forgiven than my sins' creates a tension where economic relief is prioritized over ontological reconciliation.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus quotes Isaiah to show us what to do; we follow the signal.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon assumes the hearer already possesses the competence to obey if they choose to.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is viewed as 'accumulation' and 'mean thoughts'—social and ethical failures rather than a lost condition.

eschatologie.actant_van_voltooiing: Man (as the one whose obedience makes the vision reality).

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a 'Mandate' (Sender -> Subject). The Hearer is the Subject, and God is the Lawgiver. Jesus is reduced to a Helper/Signal.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the primary actor of the 'Jubilee'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make God the Subject of the Jubilee (He cancels our debt).
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'You must give back,' use 'Because God has returned you to Himself, you are now free to let go of what you hold.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the 'Accumulator' who must fix themselves.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Identify the hearer first as the one whose 'debt' was paid by Christ.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how the Gospel gives the power to divest, rather than just the command to do so.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Present greed as an idol/power that humans cannot break on their own.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To make the 'Pouvoir' of the Spirit necessary.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics (Program 2) is driving the sermon without a Soteriological (Program 1) foundation.
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: 1. God cancels our debt (Soteriology). 2. We cancel others' debts (Ethics).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has a powerful social vision but risks crushing the hearer under the weight of a 'hard command' without providing the narrative power of God's prior action.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would praise the structure and the 'yabal' metaphor; semiotics reveals the hearer is doing all the work.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might confirm the Jubilee laws; semiotics shows the sermon treats these laws as a new legalism.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that Jesus is used as a 'functional tool' (Helper) for human achievement rather than the 'Subject' of salvation.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Social Gospel' actantial structure where the 'Kingdom' is a human project motivated by a divine vision.
